subject: Investing
title: Duration: Measuring Rate Sensitivity
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Duration: Measuring Rate Sensitivity.

hook.text: Two bond funds both yield 4%. But one drops 5% when rates rise and the other drops 15%. Duration explains why.

buildup.text: Duration measures a bond's sensitivity to interest rate changes. Higher duration means bigger price swings.

discovery.text: A duration of 7 means the bond loses about 7% for every 1% rise in rates. Simple and powerful.

twist.text: Zero-coupon bonds have the highest duration because all cash flow arrives at maturity. No coupons cushion the blow.

climax.text: Silicon Valley Bank collapsed in 2023 partly because it held long-duration bonds that cratered when rates spiked.

punchline.text: Duration is the risk dial on your bond portfolio. Know your number.

quiz.question: What does a bond duration of 7 mean?
options: The bond loses about 7% for every 1% rate increase
